titles.title: Sentencing Guidelines Transition Act of 1987
Sentencing Guidelines Stay of Implementation Act of 1987

A bill to provide for an orderly transition to the taking effect of the initial set of sentencing guidelines prescribed for criminal cases under section 994 of title 28, United States Code, and for other purposes.

bill.summary: 10/2/1987--Reported to House amended. (Reported to House from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment, H. Rept. 100-336) Sentencing Guidelines Stay of Implementation Act of 1987 - Amends the Comprehensive Crime Control Act of 1984 to delay the implementation of the sentencing guidelines developed by the U.S. Sentencing Commission. States that such guidelines will only apply to offenses committed after the effective date of the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984. Establishes an expedited review process for the review of constitutional challenges to the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984 or any guideline submitted to the Congress by the Commission. Permits a court to depart from such guidelines when an aggravating or mitigating circumstance, not taken into account by such guidelines, provides a compelling reason.
